1.text: Let us therefore fear, lest a promise being left us of entering into his rest, any of you should seem to come short of it.

2.text: For to us was the gospel preached, as well as to them: but the word which they heard did not profit them, not being mixed with faith in them that heard it.

3.text: For we who have believed do enter into rest, as he said, As I have sworn in my wrath, if they shall enter into my rest: although the works were finished from the foundation of the world.

4.text: For he spoke in a certain place of the seventh day on this wise, And God rested the seventh day from all his works.

5.text: And in this place again, If they shall enter into my rest.

6.text: Seeing therefore it remaineth that some must enter into it, and they to whom it was first preached entered not because of unbelief:

7.text: (Again, he limiteth a certain day, saying in David, To-day, after so long a time; as it is said, To-day, if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts.

8.text: For if Jesus had given them rest, then he would not afterward have spoken of another day.

9.text: There remaineth therefore a rest to the people of God.

10.text: For he that hath entered into his rest, he also hath ceased from his own works, as God did from his.)

11.text: Let us labor therefore to enter into that rest, lest any man fall after the same example of unbelief.

12.text: For the word of God is living, and powerful, and sharper than any two-edged sword, piercing even to the dividing asunder of soul and spirit, and of the joints and marrow, and is a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart.

13.text: Neither is there any creature that is not manifest in his sight: but all things are naked and opened to the eyes of him with whom we have to do.

14.text: Seeing then that we have a great High Priest, that hath passed into the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold fast our profession.

15.text: For we have not a high priest who cannot be touched with the feeling of our infirmities; but who was in all points tempted as we are, yet without sin.

16.text: Let us therefore come boldly to the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy, and find grace to help in time of need.
